creator: chazwilliams16
title: Arduino Interval Motor
description: This project uses an Arduino UNO to control a toy motor, pulsing it on and off in intervals. This setup can be used for applications like a fan or vibrator.
steps: Gather all necessary components including the Arduino UNO, resistor, diode, transistor, and toy motor.
Place the motor, diode, and transistor on the breadboard in separate areas.
Connect the resistor to the base of the transistor.
Hook up jumper wires to complete the circuit, referring to the provided picture for guidance.
Upload the Arduino UNO code (sketch_sep21a.ino) to the board.
Modify variables in the code to adjust the motor's on and off delay intervals.
